abstract.p: Catherine Coveney letter on May 2 article complains doctors fail to read patients' charts; drawing

block.p: It is all very well to suggest that doctors take more detailed information for charts, but I think we should start with getting doctors to read the charts they now put together (''A Case for Expanding the Doctor's Checklist'').
I speak as one who has been given medicine I was known to be allergic to and being told by one doctor, ''If I read the chart of everyone I see I wouldn't get to see everybody.''

It is all very well to suggest that doctors take more detailed information for charts, but I think we should start with getting doctors to read the charts they now put together (''A Case for Expanding the Doctor's Checklist'').
I speak as one who has been given medicine I was known to be allergic to and being told by one doctor, ''If I read the chart of everyone I see I wouldn't get to see everybody.''
I firmly believe that in medicine, a motto must be, ''When all else fails read the chart.''
